items.title: Flight: Clark ‚Üí El Nido
items.detail: Cebu Pacific/AirSWIFT ATR 42-600 turboprop, ~1 hr 30 min. Airport check-in only ‚Äî arrive 2 hours early. Baggage not included in base fare.
items.directions: Clark International Airport (CRK) Terminal 2. AirSWIFT check-in counter opens 2 hours before departure. No online check-in available.

items.title: Arrive El Nido Lio Airport
items.detail: Small boutique airport 15 min north of El Nido town. Pre-arranged van transfer for the group.
items.directions: Van pickup pre-arranged with hotel. Private van to El Nido town ‚Ç±1,500-2,000, or ‚Ç±200-300/person shared. 15-minute drive south.

items.title: Check In ‚Äî El Nido
items.detail: Villa or adjacent family rooms for the group. Settle in, rest after early flight.
items.directions: Hotel in El Nido town or Lio Beach area. Villa with multiple rooms ideal for the group of 8.

items.title: Nacpan Beach
items.detail: One of the Philippines' most beautiful long-stretch beaches. Expansive enough for the kids to run and play with plenty of space. Golden sand, palm trees, gentle waves.
items.directions: 30 minutes north of El Nido town by van. Road is paved but bumpy in sections. Van can drop off and pick up ‚Äî arrange return time with driver.

items.title: Dinner on Hama Street
items.detail: El Nido's main restaurant strip along the beachfront. Seafood, Filipino, and international options. ‚Ç±300-600/person.
items.directions: Walk the beachfront in El Nido town. Hama Street runs parallel to the shore ‚Äî dozens of restaurants to choose from.

items.title: Pay El Nido Eco-Tourism Fee
items.detail: One-time fee of ‚Ç±400/person. Covers all tours during your stay. Pay at the municipal tourism office before boarding.
items.directions: El Nido Municipal Tourism Office near the main beach. Open from 7 AM. Pay before your first boat tour.

items.title: Private Boat ‚Äî Tour A (Bacuit Bay)
items.detail: Full-day island hopping on private bangka for the group. Flexible pace, avoid crowds. Lunch prepared by boat crew (BBQ seafood at Shimizu Island). ‚Ç±8,000-12,000 for private boat.
items.directions: Depart from El Nido main beach. Private boat captain meets you at the beach. Life jackets provided for all.

items.title: Big Lagoon
items.detail: Towering limestone cliffs surrounding crystal-clear turquoise water. Kayak rentals ‚Ç±150/person. The older kids will love paddling through the dramatic canyon.
items.directions: First stop on Tour A, ~30 min by boat from El Nido beach. Kayak rental stand at the lagoon entrance.

items.title: Secret Lagoon
items.detail: Hidden pool accessible through a small rock opening. Shallow and calm ‚Äî great for our toddler and the kids. Magical enclosed cove.
items.directions: Short boat ride from Big Lagoon. Wade through a narrow rock opening to reach the hidden pool inside.

items.title: Lunch at Shimizu Island
items.detail: BBQ seafood lunch prepared by the boat crew on the beach. White sand, excellent snorkeling with abundant fish and coral nearby.
items.directions: Boat crew sets up lunch on the beach. Snorkel gear available for reef exploration right offshore.

items.title: Seven Commandos Beach
items.detail: Long sandy beach with coconut palms, perfect for kids to play. Snorkeling with sea turtles sometimes spotted offshore.
items.directions: Last major stop on Tour A. Sandy beach with shade from palm trees. Small bar selling drinks.

items.title: Private Boat ‚Äî Tour C
items.detail: Widely considered the most scenic El Nido tour. Private boat for flexible timing with the kids. ‚Ç±8,000-12,000 for private boat.
items.directions: Same departure beach as Tour A. Boat captain meets you at the main beach at 9 AM.

items.title: Helicopter Island
items.detail: Named for its distinctive helicopter shape. Excellent snorkeling directly off the beach ‚Äî eels, pufferfish, vibrant marine life. One of the best spots for underwater photos.
items.directions: ~45 min boat ride from El Nido. Snorkel right off the beach ‚Äî reef starts just meters from shore.

items.title: Secret Beach
items.detail: Fully enclosed cove surrounded by limestone walls, accessible by swimming through a narrow crevice. Magical and unforgettable. Older kids will love the adventure. Not suitable for toddler ‚Äî nannies stay on boat.
items.directions: Swim through a narrow rock crevice to reach the hidden beach inside. Life jackets recommended. Water depth at entrance varies with tide.

items.title: Lunch on the Boat
items.detail: Crew-prepared BBQ lunch. Fresh seafood, rice, fruit.
items.directions: Served aboard or on a nearby beach depending on conditions.

items.title: Matinloc Shrine
items.detail: Historic shrine built into a limestone cliff with panoramic views of the surrounding islands. Great photo spot.
items.directions: Boat docks at the shrine pier. Short walk up stone steps to the shrine and viewpoint.

items.title: Hidden Beach
items.detail: Secluded paradise tucked behind towering cliffs, only accessible at certain tides. Check tide table with boat captain.
items.directions: Accessible by swimming from the boat to shore. Tide-dependent ‚Äî captain knows the timing.
items.weatherNote: Accessible at low tide only ‚Äî captain will check conditions

items.title: Expedition Departs El Nido
items.detail: Private bangka charter begins. 2-day, 1-night island-hopping expedition through the Linapacan Islands to Coron. All meals, snorkeling gear, and overnight included. ‚Ç±20,000-35,000 for the group.
items.directions: Depart from El Nido pier or hotel pickup. Crew loads supplies and departs by 8-9 AM. Bring waterproof bags for electronics.

items.title: Island Stop ‚Äî Snorkeling
items.detail: First island stop in Linapacan. Some of the clearest water in the Philippines ‚Äî often beating both El Nido and Coron for water clarity. Pristine reef, untouched by mass tourism.
items.directions: Crew navigates to the best conditions. 2-4 island stops along the route. Snorkeling gear provided.

items.title: Lunch on the Beach
items.detail: Fresh-caught seafood, rice, and local dishes prepared by the boat crew. Served alfresco on a remote island beach.
items.directions: Crew selects a beach with shade. Lunch is prepared onboard and served on the sand.

items.title: Remote Beach Exploration
items.detail: White-sand beaches, vibrant snorkeling reefs, and small fishing villages. Very few tourists ‚Äî almost completely untouched.
items.directions: Crew navigates to best islands based on weather and conditions.

items.title: Overnight ‚Äî Linapacan Island Camp
items.detail: Beachfront kubo (traditional bamboo cottage) or tent on the sand. Dinner prepared by crew ‚Äî fresh seafood and campfire on the beach. Sleeping under the stars.
items.directions: Crew handles all logistics. Bring toddler essentials ‚Äî no stores on the island. Insect repellent recommended for evening.

items.title: Sunrise & Breakfast at Camp
items.detail: Wake up on a remote island beach. Crew prepares breakfast. Last morning in the Linapacan wilderness.
items.directions: Breakfast served at the campsite. Pack up and prepare for departure.

items.title: Continue North to Coron
items.detail: Day 2 of the expedition. More island stops through Linapacan and Culion islands as we head toward Coron.
items.directions: Crew handles navigation. ~5-6 hours of sailing with multiple stops.

items.title: Ditaytayan Sandbar
items.detail: One of the most beautiful sandbars in Palawan. Dramatic strip of white sand extending between islands with turquoise water on both sides.
items.directions: En route to Coron. Crew stops for swimming and photos. Shallow water ‚Äî safe for kids.

items.title: Lunch on the Water
items.detail: Final expedition meal prepared by the crew. Fresh seafood BBQ on a beach stop.
items.directions: Crew selects a sheltered beach for lunch.

items.title: Arrive Coron Town
items.detail: Expedition ends at Coron port. Transfer to hotel. Rest and explore Coron town on foot.
items.directions: Coron port is walkable to most hotels. Tricycle to hotel ‚Ç±50-100 if needed. Town is small and walkable.

items.title: Dinner in Coron Town
items.detail: Waterfront restaurants along the pier area. Filipino seafood and international options. ‚Ç±300-500/person.
items.directions: Walk along the main street near the public market and pier. Several restaurants with water views.

items.title: Private Boat ‚Äî Coron Tour A
items.detail: New Year's Eve island hopping. The iconic highlights of Coron ‚Äî lakes, lagoons, and beaches. Private boat to start early and beat crowds. ‚Ç±8,000-12,000.
items.directions: Depart from Coron pier. Private boat captain meets at 8 AM. Start early ‚Äî Kayangan gets crowded by 10 AM.

items.title: Kayangan Lake
items.detail: Known as the cleanest lake in the Philippines. Short hike up limestone steps to iconic viewpoint (the postcard shot of Coron), then down to crystal-clear freshwater lake. ‚Ç±300/person entrance. Life jackets required.
items.directions: First stop ‚Äî arrive early to beat tour groups. Hike is ~10 min up stairs. Doable with toddler in carrier. Viewpoint at the top, then descend to the lake.

items.title: Twin Lagoon
items.detail: Two turquoise lagoons separated by a thin limestone wall. At low tide, swim through underwater passage between them. At high tide, wooden stairs to climb over. Warm-cool temperature contrast is fascinating for kids. Kayak rentals available.
items.directions: Short boat ride from Kayangan. Tide determines access method ‚Äî captain will advise. Bring underwater camera.

items.title: Lunch at CYC Beach
items.detail: White sand beach, perfect lunch stop. Crew-prepared BBQ. Kids can play on the beach while adults eat.
items.directions: Beach with shade structures. Calm shallow water for kids.

items.title: Barracuda Lake
items.detail: Unique lake with thermocline layers ‚Äî cold freshwater on top, warm saltwater below. Surreal swimming experience as you pass through temperature layers.
items.directions: Short hike from the dock. Similar to Kayangan but less crowded in afternoon.

items.title: Coral Garden Snorkeling
items.detail: Shallow, vibrant snorkeling spot ideal for beginners and children. Abundant fish and healthy coral.
items.directions: Last stop before returning. Shallow reef ‚Äî safe for kids with life jackets.

items.title: New Year's Eve Celebration
items.detail: Celebrate at your resort or waterfront restaurant. Coron town does fireworks at midnight over the bay.
items.directions: Waterfront restaurants along the pier for dinner with views. Fireworks visible from most locations near the water.

items.title: Private Boat ‚Äî Coron Tour C
items.detail: Remote outer islands south of Coron. Stunning white-sand beaches rather than lakes and lagoons. ‚Ç±8,000-12,000 for private boat.
items.directions: Depart from Coron pier. Longer boat ride to outer islands ‚Äî ~1 hour to first stop.

items.title: Malcapuya Island
items.detail: Powdery white sand beach with calm, shallow turquoise water. Perfect for families ‚Äî toddler can wade safely and older kids can snorkel.
items.directions: ~1 hour by boat from Coron. Shallow entry, sandy bottom. No sharp coral near shore.

items.title: Beach Lunch at Banana Island
items.detail: Quiet beach with excellent snorkeling along the reef edge. Crew prepares lunch on the beach.
items.directions: Short boat ride from Malcapuya. Reef snorkeling is right offshore.

items.title: Bulog Dos Island
items.detail: Dramatic sandbar extending between two islands. Great for photos and wading. Shallow water all around.
items.directions: En route back to Coron. Sandbar is exposed at low tide ‚Äî check tide with captain.

items.title: Maquinit Hot Springs
items.detail: One of the only saltwater hot springs in the Philippines. Naturally heated to 38-40¬∞C by underground volcanic activity. Stone-lined pools surrounded by mangroves with ocean views. ‚Ç±200-300/adult, ‚Ç±100/child.
items.directions: 20 min by tricycle from Coron town on a bumpy scenic road. Round-trip tricycle ‚Ç±400-700 ‚Äî driver waits for you. Bring insect repellent (near mangroves).

items.title: Pack & Check Out
items.detail: Final morning in Coron. Check out of hotel, organize luggage for the group.
items.directions: Hotel checkout. Secure transport to airport ‚Äî pre-arrange van for 8 people.

items.title: Transfer to Busuanga Airport
items.detail: 30-45 min drive from Coron town to Francisco B. Reyes Airport (USU). Environmental/tourist fee ‚Ç±200/person collected at airport departure.
items.directions: Van from Coron town to Busuanga Airport. Road is paved, ~30-45 min. Arrive 1.5 hours before flight.

items.title: Flight: Coron ‚Üí Clark
items.detail: PAL or Cebu Pacific/Cebgo, ~1 hr 15-30 min. Daily flights available since March 2026.
items.directions: Francisco B. Reyes Airport (USU). Small airport ‚Äî check-in counter only. ‚Ç±200/person environmental fee at departure.

items.title: Arrive Clark ‚Äî Trip Complete!
items.detail: Welcome home. 8 days, 3 destinations, countless memories.
items.directions: Clark International Airport (CRK). Private vehicle pickup or Grab home.

notifications.text: Dry season confirmed for Dec 26‚ÄìJan 2. Calm seas expected ‚Äî ideal for island hopping and Linapacan expedition.
booked private bangka for Tour A and Tour C in El Nido
USD/PHP rate updated: ‚Ç±58.00. Budget tracker refreshed.
All devices synced. Last update: 5 min ago.

changeLog.title: Maquinit Hot Springs
changeLog.detail: Added evening hot springs visit on Day 7 ‚Äî perfect way to end the adventure

changeLog.title: Expedition route
changeLog.reason: Linapacan has the clearest water in the Philippines ‚Äî can't skip it

changeLog.title: Flight booking
changeLog.detail: Booked CRK‚ÄìENI and USU‚ÄìCRK flights for 8 seats. Cebu Pacific/AirSWIFT. Peak season ‚Äî glad we booked early.
